alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Hardeman; Hardin; Henderson; Madison; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 5:56PM CDT until April 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Henderson County in western Tennessee... Hardeman County in western Tennessee... Southern Benton County in western Tennessee... McNairy County in western Tennessee... Southern Carroll County in western Tennessee... Hardin County in western Tennessee... Madison County in western Tennessee... Chester County in western Tennessee... Decatur County in western Tennessee... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 556 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Milan to near Chickasaw State Park to near Lagrange, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jackson, Lexington, Savannah, Henderson, Bolivar, Selmer, Pickwick Landing State Park, Natchez Trace State Park, Chickasaw State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Chickasaw State Forest, Big Hill Pond State Park, Parsons, Adamsville, Decaturville, Sardis, Silerton, Pickwick Dam, Masseyville and Reagan. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Hardeman; Hardin; Henderson; Madison; McNairy
